intro: Pyrenocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces spherical, fleshy berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Pyrenocarpa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its unique appearance and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in botanical gardens and native landscapes.
